column4: Hello, I've just installed gnome-bluetooth but I don't know the passcode to complete the connection between my PC and my bluetooth device. Any ideas on what's the default?
Which bluetooth device?
my mobile phone, sony w600
You will be asked for the passcode when connecting. Just enter a code and enter the same code on your phone.
Atleast that's how it works with the T610, K700i and w800
It just prompts for the passcode, and anything I type in it says it's wrong...
You may need to set up the phone to ask for passcodes instead of using a default one. Please refer to the phone manual.
ok I'll do that, thank you!
how can I send a file from the PC to the mobile? the inverse way I got working
hmm.. hang on.
any luck? I got none yet :P
I found one "filesharing with bluetooth" thingy, but it won't load. Atleat not in dapper.
I found one thing telling me to right click a file and select 'send via bluetooth' but there's no such thing :P
Actually I've got that feature in dapper
Right click and choose "Send To"
There you can choose evolution or Bluetooth (OBEX)
there's only evolution on Send to
have you got the Bluetooth (OBEX) option then?
no bluetooth under Send To
Hmm.. have you got gnome-bluetooth installed?
yes I got
